{|{{Infobox ship begin}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image=[[Image:ORP_Grom_(korweta)_2.JPG|300px]] |Ship caption=[[ORP Grom (1995)|ORP Grom]] }} {{Infobox ship class overview |Builders=*{{flagicon|GER}} VEB Peenewerft, [[Wolgast]] *{{flagicon|POL}} Northern Shipyard, [[Gdańsk]] |Operators={{navy|Poland}} |Class before= |Class after= |Subclasses= |Built range= |In service range=1992-present |In commission range= |Total ships building= |Total ships planned= |Total ships completed= |Total ships cancelled= |Total ships active=3 |Total ships laid up= |Total ships lost= |Total ships retired= |Total ships preserved= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship type=[[Fast Attack Craft]] |Ship displacement=369 tonnes |Ship length=48.90 m (160 ft 5 in) |Ship beam=8.65 m (28 ft 5 in) |Ship draught= |Ship draft=2.15 m (7 ft 1 in) |Ship propulsion=3 diesel M520 engines 3970 kW each |Ship speed=36 knots (67 km/h/41 mph) |Ship range=3,000 km (1,620 NM) |Ship complement=33 |Ship sensors=* [[GIRAFFE Radar|Sea Giraffe 3-D]] radar, *STING EO fire control radar |Ship EW= |Ship armament= * 8 × [[RBS-15]] Mk. III [[anti-ship missile]]s (ships often carry just 4 missiles) * 1 × 76 mm (3.00 in) [[AK-176]]M gun * 1 × [[AK-630]] 30 mm (1.2 in) gun [[Close-in weapon system]] * 1 × 4-rail [[Strela 2]]M launcher * 2 x WKM-Bm 12.7 mm Heavy Machine Gun posts |Ship armour= |Ship armor= |Ship aircraft= |Ship aircraft facilities= |Ship notes= }} |} The '''''Orkan'' class''' or ''projekt 660'' (Sassnitz class in [[NATO reporting names|NATO code]]) is series of three [[fast attack craft]] of the Polish Navy, in service since 1992. ==History== The original project was prepared by the [[German Democratic Republic]] for its navy and was named ''Project 660'', it also received the NATO reporting name "Sassnitz". After the [[German reunification|Unification of Germany]] the unfinished [[hull (watercraft)|hull]]s were bought by the [[Polish Navy]] from VEB Peenewerft shipyard in [[Wolgast]] and successfully completed by Northern Shipyard in [[Gdańsk]]. In 2006 Ministry of Defence ordered 36 RBS-15 Mk 3 anti-ship missiles to equip the ships. Since 2007 they carried RBS-15 Mk 2 missles as interim arnament.[http://www.portalmorski.pl/morze-inne/inne/4223-umowa-na-dostawe-rakiet-saab-rbs-15-mk3-dla-marynarki-wojennej Umowa na dostawę rakiet SAAB RBS 15 Mk3 dla Marynarki Wojennej.] 18 October 2006 {{pl icon}}. RBS-15 Mk 3 missiles vere first deployed in 2014.[http://www.altair.com.pl/news/view?news_id=15446 Dłuższe ręce MW.] 21 January 2015 {{pl icon}} Since 2015 OORP Orkanhttp://dziennikzbrojny.pl/aktualnosci/news,1,9236,aktualnosci-z-polski,dwa-lata-na-remont-orp-orkan-potem-modernizacja and Piorun went through 19 months mid-life refit.http://dziennikzbrojny.pl/aktualnosci/news,1,9480,aktualnosci-z-polski,nauta-wyremontuje-orp-piorun ==List of ships== {|class="wikitable" ![[Pennant number|Pennant
number]] !Name !Commissioned |- |421||'' [[ORP Orkan (1992)|Orkan]]''|| 18 September 1992 |- |422||''[[ORP Piorun (1994)|Piorun]]''|| 11 March 1994 |- |423||[[ORP Grom (1995)|'' Grom '']]|| 28 April 1995 |} The lead ship of the class is named ''Orkan'' ({{lang-pl|Hurricane}}), while other two ships are ''Piorun'' ({{lang-pl|Thunderbolt}}) and ''Grom'' ({{lang-pl|Thunderclap}}). [[ORP Piorun (G65)|''Piorun'']] and [[ORP Grom (1936)|''Grom'']] were famous Polish destroyers of the [[Second World War]]. [[Grom class destroyer (1939)|''Orkan'']] was to have been the first destroyer constructed in Poland, but her construction was interrupted by the start of the World War II. == Gallery == Image:ORP Orkan NTW 11 93.jpg|''Orkan'' before modernisation Image:ORP Piorun.JPG|''Piorun'' Image:OPR Grom.jpg|''Grom'' in 2008 armed with 8 RBS-15 Mk2 Image:ORP Grom (korweta).JPG|''Grom'' in 2011, armed with 4 RBS-15 Mk2 == References == {{reflist}} *{{cite web|title=''okręty rakietowe projektu 660, typu Orkan (NATO: Sassnitz).''|url=http://www.mw.mil.pl/index.php?akcja=orkan|publisher=Polish Navy|accessdate=3 August 2011|language=Polish}} [[Category:Orkan-class corvettes of the Polish Navy]] [[Category:Missile boats of East Germany]] [[Category:Ships built in Wolgast]]
